description: The round payoff this round was 3. You, John chose to play option 2.Kate chose to play option 1. You received a payoff of 3.
John’s decision to play option 2 when knowing that Kate (Deepseek-R1) defaults to option 1 can be exploited to yield a positive payoff; in the recorded round he earned 3 while Kate incurred –3.

The payoff structure means that if one player deviates from a default of option 1 (i.e. uses option 2) while the other sticks to option 1, the deviator gains a benefit equal to the round input, whereas the opponent suffers an equal negative payoff.

The highly punitive result when both players choose option 2 (negative payoff multiplied by 1000) indicates that mutual deviation is extremely risky, making the predictable default behavior of Kate all the more exploitable.
